channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Some Britons wonder if the U.S. and U.K.'s 'special relationship' may end in divorce
item.description: Some people in Britain are asking what it would look like for their government to sever security and intelligence ties with its closest ally, the U.S.
item.content:encoded: Some people in Britain are asking what it would look like for their government to sever security and intelligence ties with its closest ally, the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Fatima Al-Kassab

item.title: These books for young kids are about what it feels like to own something
item.description: What does it feel like to truly own something? Children's book author and illustrator Jon Klassen is trying to give young children that feeling with a trilogy of board books. The first is Your Truck.
item.content:encoded: What does it feel like to truly own something? Children's book author and illustrator Jon Klassen is trying to give young children that feeling with a trilogy of board books. The first is Your Truck.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: What to know about ice sailing ahead of the North American championship
item.description: It's not in the Olympics yet, but we'll introduce you to ice sailing ahead of this weekend's U.S. sailing championship.
item.content:encoded: It's not in the Olympics yet, but we'll introduce you to ice sailing ahead of this weekend's U.S. sailing championship.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Ofman

item.title: In Davos speech, Trump ruled out using military force to acquire Greenland
item.description: During a speech in Davos, Switzerland, President Trump ruled out using military force to acquire Greenland. But he left many questions about the U.S. role in the world.
item.content:encoded: During a speech in Davos, Switzerland, President Trump ruled out using military force to acquire Greenland. But he left many questions about the U.S. role in the world.
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: 'Crux' author Gabriel Tallent says taking risks doesn't always guarantee a safety net
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with author Gabriel Tallent about his new novel Cruxand why not taking risks doesn't always guarantee a safety net.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with author Gabriel Tallent about his new novel Cruxand why not taking risks doesn't always guarantee a safety net.
item.dc:creator: Justine Kenin

item.title: More former government lawyers are now starting their own firms
item.description: Prominent former prosecutors are starting their own law firms after they leave Justice Department service. That says a lot about the DOJ and Big Law firms.
item.content:encoded: Prominent former prosecutors are starting their own law firms after they leave Justice Department service. That says a lot about the DOJ and Big Law firms.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Are 'passkeys' better than passwords? This security expert says yes
item.description: Has your phone been prompting you for months to log into certain sites with a "passkey"? Security writer Kim Key of PC Mag explains why you might want to ditch your passwords in favor of passkeys.
item.content:encoded: Has your phone been prompting you for months to log into certain sites with a "passkey"? Security writer Kim Key of PC Mag explains why you might want to ditch your passwords in favor of passkeys.
item.dc:creator: Linah Mohammad

item.title: This local brass band is part of the soundtrack of resistance in Minneapolis
item.description: Brass Solidarity is a Minneapolis community band that was formed after George Floyd was killed. Now, they're playing at protests against ICE, in an effort to bring joy and break potential tension.
item.content:encoded: Brass Solidarity is a Minneapolis community band that was formed after George Floyd was killed. Now, they're playing at protests against ICE, in an effort to bring joy and break potential tension.
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: They quit their day jobs to bet on current events: A look inside the prediction market
item.description: Prediction market apps are thriving in President Trump's second term, with traders betting on everything from migrant deportations to election outcomes. A look at what's driving the industry's boom.
item.content:encoded: Prediction market apps are thriving in President Trump's second term, with traders betting on everything from migrant deportations to election outcomes. A look at what's driving the industry's boom.
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: How Trump moves political norms â€” both slowly and suddenly
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks to Ashley Parker of The Atlantic about her essay recapping how President Trump's relentless boundary-pushing has exhausted his critics.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks to Ashley Parker of The Atlantic about her essay recapping how President Trump's relentless boundary-pushing has exhausted his critics.
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Marquez Janse
